title: Quakes rattle New Zealand but no reports of major damage
description: A series of moderately strong earthquakes has rattled New Zealand’s North Island but there are no immediate reports of major damage or injuries

title: Neighborhood fights Haiti gangs after vigilante killings
description: Resident in the hilly suburbs of Haiti’s capital are arming themselves with machetes, bottles and rocks and fighting back against encroaching gangs after a crowd beat and burned 13 suspected gang members to death in a gruesome outburst of vigilante violence

title: Pakistani health officials confirm first case of monkeypox
description: Pakistani authorities say a man has tested positive for monkeypox, becoming the country’s first confirmed case of the disease

title: Mexico immigration agency head arraigned in deadly fire
description: The head of Mexico’s immigration agency was arraigned on charges Tuesday that he failed in his responsibility to protect those in his custody when 40 migrants died in a fire at a border detention center last month

title: Kenya cult deaths hits 90 as authorities expand operation
description: The death toll at a ranch in coastal Kenya that is owned by a pastor who is accused of leading a cult and ordering his followers to starve themselves reached 90

title: Jailed strongman's whereabouts unknown amid Sudan chaos
description: An attack on the prison holding deposed Sudanese strongman Omar al-Bashir has raised questions about his whereabouts as the country’s two top generals battle for power

title: 7 dead in rural Mexico clash between soldiers, gunmen
description: Seven people are dead, including one soldier, following a shootout between gunmen and troops in rural western Mexico

title: Tobacco company pleads guilty to violating U.S. sanctions on North Korea
description: British American Tobacco, a London-based company with a subsidiary based in Singapore, must pay $630 million in fines to the U.S. government.

title: Japanese startup loses contact with spacecraft during moon landing
description: The ending was a disappointment for a company that had hoped to become the first commerical enterprise to land a spacecraft on the moon.

title: A dying Daniel Ellsberg talks about Discord and the power of leaks
description: The man behind the Pentagon Papers is confronting terminal pancreatic cancer. He says the Discord leaks make clear the dangers of the Ukraine war

title: Senior German priest resigns over handling of abuse claims
description: The German Catholic Church says a senior priest has been removed from office after criticism of his handling of abuse allegations against a seminary director in the Limburg Diocese

title: Guaidó, former Venezuelan opposition leader, lands in U.S. for ‘refuge’
description: The 39-year-old engineer, once recognized by the United States and more than 50 other countries as Venezuela's rightful leader, has seen his support collapse.

title: Mass killing of civilians by security forces in Burkina Faso
description: The United Nations says at least 150 civilians may have been killed and many others injured in violence in northern Burkina Faso

title: Syria condemns EU sanctions over amphetamine business
description: Syria has condemned the European Union’s new sanctions on Damascus over making and trafficking an amphetamine, saying the move was based on lies

title: Spain pleads for EU crisis funds as drought hits farmers
description: Spain’s Agriculture Minister Luis Planas has requested emergency funds from the European Union to support farmers and ranchers amid extreme drought conditions in the country’s agricultural heartlands

title: Video shows skier’s terrifying plunge into a deep glacier crevasse
description: The skier fell about 15 meters into a crevasse in a glacier near La Grave before coming to a stop, according to Les Powtos, a French ski group that shared the video.

title: Harry Belafonte, barrier-smashing entertainer and activist, dies at 96
description: A star after “The Banana Boat Song,” he became a key ally of the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. during the civil rights struggle.

title: Colombia hosts conference on Venezuela's political crisis
description: Diplomats from 20 countries are gathering in Colombia for a conference in on the political crisis in Venezuela, where Nicolas Maduro’s socialist administration has strengthened its autocratic rule despite international efforts to expand political freedoms in the South American nation

title: Sweden expels 5 Russian Embassy staff on suspicion of spying
description: Sweden has informed Russia that five employees with the Russian Embassy in Stockholm have been asked to leave the country, saying they are suspected of spying

title: Prince Harry suit against Murdoch reveals secret Prince William payoff
description: Prince Harry is suing Rupert Murdoch's British media operation over phone hacking. In documents submitted to the court, Harry’s legal team alleged there was a secret payment — made in 2020 — from Murdoch’s company to Prince William.

title: Germany detains Syrian suspected of planning Islamist attack
description: German authorities have detained a Syrian man on suspicion of planning to carry out an explosives attack motivated by Islamic extremism

title: Prince William got 'very large sum' in phone hack settlement
description: Court papers say that Prince William quietly received “a very large sum of money” in a 2020 phone hacking settlement with the British newspaper arm of Rupert Murdoch’s media empire

title: UN fears more 'displacement' from Sudan despite cease-fire
description: The U.N. refugee agency is warning of “further displacement” of people from Sudan after thousands have streamed into neighboring countries of Chad and South Sudan

title: Court reject family's bid to change Russian-sounding surname
description: A court in Germany has rejected a married couple’s request to legally change their Russian-sounding surname

title: Suspicious object halts trains in Japanese city hosting G-7
description: Police in Japan are investigating a suspicious object found in a paper bag inside a commercial building connected to the Hiroshima train station

title: Farmers rally over first lady's comments on banning dog meat
description: Dozens of dog farmers in South Korea are rallying to criticize the country’s first lady over her reported comments supporting a possible ban on dog meat consumption

title: Ex-Wagner Group member faces Norway court for bar brawl
description: A former member of the Russian private military contractor Wagner Group who is seeking asylum in Norway has admitted resisting arrest and carrying an air gun

title: Turkey: 110 detained over suspected Kurdish militant links
description: Turkey’s state-run news agency says police have detained 110 people for alleged links to Kurdish militants in raids across 21 provinces

title: WHO fires doctor after findings of sexual misconduct by him
description: The World Health Organization says it has fired one of its doctors who faced allegations, first reported by The Associated Press, that he had repeatedly engaged in sexual misconduct

title: UBS reaps $28B in new assets in 1Q; Credit Suisse deal looms
description: Swiss bank UBS says it took in $28 billion of net new money for its wealth management business in the first quarter, with $7 billion of that coming after the announcement of its government-backed takeover of ailing rival Credit Suisse

title: 1 killed, 10 wounded as Russian forces hit Ukrainian museum
description: A Russian missile has hit a museum building in a Ukrainian city, killing one of its workers and injuring 10 other people, part of a relentless barrage that comes as Ukraine is gathering its forces for a planned counteroffensive

title: With new cease-fire, Sudan’s capital finds rare, yet shaky, calm
description: Taking advantage of the tentative cease-fire, Britain has announced that air force planes will start evacuating its citizens from the capital Khartoum.

title: Long days of gravediggers tell story of Ukraine's war dead
description: There will be four funerals today in the section for fallen soldiers at main cemetery in the city of Kryvyi Rih

title: Singapore to execute man for conspiring to traffic 2 pounds of cannabis
description: Tangaraju Suppiah's death sentence put the spotlight back on Singapore's harsh stance toward a drug that is being decriminalized in much of the West.

title: Israel marks Memorial Day plagued by divisions, violence
description: Israel is marking its Memorial Day for fallen soldiers and victims of militant attacks amid some of the nation’s deepest political divisions in history

title: Fitful start to new 3-day truce in Sudan; airlifts continue
description: Sudan’s warring generals have pledged to observe a new three-day truce that was brokered by the United States and Saudi Arabia to try to pull Africa’s third-largest nation from the abyss

title: Ukraine live briefing: Approval of Russia drops in virtually every part of the world, Gallup says
description: In Ukraine, the approval rating for U.S. leadership jumped by 29 percentage points to 66 percent, according to the “Rating World Leaders” report by Gallup.

title: Pakistani police say electrical shorts caused deadly blasts
description: Pakistani police say the twin blasts that struck a counterterrorism facility in the country’s northwest and killed 13 people the day before were caused by electrical shorts and not a terror attack, as initially suggested

title: Hundreds gather in Turkey to remember WWI dead on Anzac Day
description: Hundreds of people have gathered near the former World War I battlefields in Turkey to pay homage to soldiers from Australia and New Zealand who died in a disastrous campaign 108 years ago

title: A new threat rises in earthquake-battered Turkey: Mountains of rubble
description: In Samandag, the dump sites are another blow to a wounded town, sparking protests by residents and environmental activists, and fears of future health problems.

title: Political crisis threatens to overshadow Israel’s most sacrosanct holiday
description: Thousands of family members of the more than 20,000 Israelis killed in their country’s conflicts say Memorial Day has been tainted this year by politics.

title: Russia’s ‘April Fools’ session at the Security Council stirs anger
description: Sessions held by Russia while the nation chairs the U.N. Security Council this month turned into a rare face-to-face confrontation between Moscow and some of its leading adversaries.
